question: 'What is the exam schedule/timetable?'
answers: 'Alternatively  exam schedule is always shared in your WhatsApp batch group by the Head Of Department or can be found on the college website.'

question: 'How to see/check result on website?'
answers: 'Navigate to the college website >> Tap the three lines on the side of the blue bar. Under the Students Corner, choose Results option >> enter your Student ID to view the result'

question: how to apply for backpaper?'
'How do I get the marksheet?'
answers: 'Students can retrieve their marksheet from counter no. 6 in the administrative department. NOTE: It may require showing your old library card or ID card.'

question: how to fill the examination form?'

question: 'What are the passinng marks/criteria?'
how can I apply for reevaluation of marks?'
'When are internal assessments conducted?'
answers: 'Internal exams are conducted twice in a semester before final external exams. It is usually of 20 marks for 2 units.

question: 'whom to contact for exam related issues?'
answers: 'Any problem you have got related to exams can easily be solved by asking the subject teacher or the Head of Department.'

question: 'How to apply for leave?'
what is the minimum attendace required?'
'what are the exam rules?'
answers: 'All the rules to be followed in an exam hall is mentioned in the examination form or in your admit card.  Students are strictly advised to read it thoroughly and follow it.'

question: does medical leave counts in attendance?'
answers: Students are asked to submit an application and a medical certificate if their attendance is less than mandatory i.e. 75%.'

question: 'What happens in case of attendance shortage?'
answers: Students are asked to submit an application and a medical certificate if their attendance is less than mandatory i.e. 75%. In case of no medical certificates, an additional fee is charged or admit card's issue process may be hindered or delayed.'

question: how can i get my id card?'
answers: ID card can be issued at the counter number 4.

question: 'how can I check my attendance?'
answers: 'Students's attendance record is maintained in a register. Anyone can ask the teacher for their attendance percentage in that specific subject. Attendance percentage is calculated at the end of each month.'
